## Gauss-Jordan Elimination

### Find the solution to the following
\begin{equation}
    \begin{cases} 
      -x_{1}  &+  &4x_{2} &+  &4x_{3} &=  &-4\\
      -x_{1}  &&& - &2x_{3} &=  &0\\ 
      -3x_{1} &&& - &4x_{3} &= &-4
    \end{cases}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation*}
A = 
\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
4 & 5 & 6 \\
7 & 8 & 9
\end{pmatrix}
\end{equation*}

#### Problem: Solve Ax = b

\begin{equation*}
A = 
\begin{pmatrix}
-1 & 4 & -4 \\
-1 & 0 & -2 \\
-3 & 0 &-4 
\end{pmatrix}
\end{equation*}

\begin{equation*}
b = 
\begin{pmatrix}
-4\\
0\\
-4
\end{pmatrix}
\end{equation*}

We're trying to find:
\begin{equation*}
x = 
\begin{pmatrix}
x_{1}\\
x_{2}\\
x_{3}
\end{pmatrix}
\end{equation*}
